result.execSummary:
The defendant Felisha Alexandria Roberts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs of $268.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Paid in full directly to Clerk of Court from bail bond money.
Any conditions that DOC may impose.
AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations

timeConds.notes: 120 days in Sawyer County jail with credit for 120 days time served

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Felisha Alexandria Roberts in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  2:59 Pm  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Plea questionnaire tendered to the court.  Court questions Atty Moldenhauer.  State recites plea agreement sentence w/held probation 5 years - 120 days county jail credit 120 days time served - AODA - provide DNA sample - costs including the surcharge.  Atty Moldenhauer agrees.  Defendant agrees.  Defendant entered plea of no contest.  Court questions defendant as to plea questionnaire.  Court finds defendant guilty.  State argues sentencing.  Atty Moldenhauer makes arguement.  Defendant addressed the Court.

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 5 years - 120 days county jail with 120 days time served - AODA and any follow thru - Submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge - costs - any other conditions DOC may impose
